abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Education Project for
            Nicaragua were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: the inadequate assessment of risks
            at the beginning of the original Project design was a major
            factor in the discontinuity of certain activities and in the
            need for restructuring. Support of all stakeholders matters,
            and it is important to maintain coalitions to support
            reforms. Project preparation should clearly identify
            possible fragile points in the coalitions to support
            reforms. Even though identifying the exact reasons why the
            government decided to abandon the school autonomy program
            goes beyond this document, there is evidence of
            dissatisfaction with the model from parents and teachers at
            its early stages, in most cases due to challenges in the
            relationship with principals. The original and the
            restructured project designs had two very different concepts
            of decentralization embedded in them, with different
            accountability mechanisms, in the original design,
            decentralization was at the school level, while during the
            restructured design, and decentralization was at the
            departmental level. Nonetheless, under both approaches,
            information is the key to accountability. But information
            coming from test can be affected by curriculum changes.
            Therefore, in order to achieve comparability through time
            tests could focus on student competences. Another option to
            assess evolution of the education system is to participate
            in international tests to provide benchmarks through time.
            These considerations have been taken into account in the
            design of the new project.
